intro: Rodriguezia arevaloi, commonly known as the Arevalo's rodriguezia, is a rare and endemic species native to the tropical rainforests of Colombia. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as an understory species, thriving in humid, shaded environments with high rainfall. Its flowers are usually white or pale green, with a distinctive, elongated shape. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
